intro: Githago gracilis, commonly known as the slender githago, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its slender stems and small, inconspicuous flowers are adapted to its specific ecological niche. Githago gracilis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native environment.
